intro: Sida chlorophis, commonly known as greenleaf sida, is a flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers and palmately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has hairy stems and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Sida chlorophis is native to the southeastern United States and parts of Central America.
